senses.de: To stop trying to do something because you find it hard
senses.ex: After 10 attempts, she gave up trying to learn guitar

Tips.title: Perseverance Context
Tips.description: Used when someone stops after repeated failures or difficulties, not an easy decision.
Tips.example: She gave up mastering the violin, despite years of practice.

Tips.title: Non-Instant Process
Tips.description: Implying a process over time; the giving up is not usually sudden.
Tips.example: Eventually, after much struggle, he gave up competing professionally.

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: Often viewed negatively, as in surrendering or lacking resilience.
Tips.example: Despite her talent, others felt she gave up too easily.

senses.de: To stop doing something you regularly do, especially a habit or an activity
senses.ex: He decided to give up smoking for his health

Tips.title: Change of Habit
Tips.description: Indicates a significant lifestyle change, often health-related.
Tips.example: For his New Year's resolution, he gave up fast food.

Tips.title: Personal Sacrifice
Tips.description: Reflects a personal choice that may involve sacrifice or willpower.
Tips.example: It was hard, but she gave up her daily coffee to save money.

senses.de: To allow somebody else to have or take something that you possess
senses.ex: He had to give up his seat to an elderly passenger

Tips.title: Act of Kindness
Tips.description: Often implies politeness or deference, as in yielding something to another.
Tips.example: The young man gave up his place in line to the pregnant lady.

Tips.title: Consideration for Others
Tips.description: Shows you're thinking about what others need or want.
Tips.example: She gave up her weekend to help her friend move.

senses.de: To admit that you are defeated or cannot do something
senses.ex: The mountain climbers gave up after many unsuccessful attempts to reach the peak

Tips.title: Acknowledgment of Defeat
Tips.description: Used when accepting failure, often reluctantly, after much effort.
Tips.example: The team gave up after the fifth overtime and accepted defeat.

Tips.title: Emotional Undertone
Tips.description: Can suggest disappointment, frustration, or resignation.
Tips.example: Visibly frustrated, the math student gave up on the problem.
